item.title: Best XP Farm in Battlefield 2042 (2025)
item.description:
Much of the content in Battlefield 2042 is locked behind an XP-based leveling system, and while this isn't exactly new to the series, this game's approach to leveling and unlocking items is a little different compared to its predecessors.

Simply playing matches and doing just about anything in BF2042 is going to net players XP, but for those who want to level up as quickly as possible to get the best weapons, equipment, and battle pass rewards, this might not be the most ideal thing to do. Luckily, there are a few things in the game that players can use to boost their XP gains significantly.

Best Account XP Farm in Battlefield 2042

During the game's earlier days, players could farm AI in Portal servers to level up at insane speeds. This can no longer be done due to XP caps and XP gain limitations, but we'll get back to this later. The best way for the average player to level up in BF2042 is to play Support on Breakthrough games .

The Support class in nearly every Battlefield game is great for farming XP because of the nature of its role. Support players in Battlefield 2042 in particular can do pretty much everything except vehicle-related tasks. They can heal, resupply, revive, spot enemies, provide smoke cover, and, of course, take out enemy players.

Many of the weapons in BF2042 are unlocked by leveling up, but a good chunk of the arsenal can only be obtained by completing challenges.

The best character to use for farming XP in BF2042 is Falck with the following loadout:

  • Weapons of choice
  • Ammo Crate
  • Smoke Grenade

Falck's Syrette Pistol lets her heal allies even without a Med Crate or Medical Pouches, which means she can take an Ammo Crate instead. With this in mind, to get as much XP as possible, stick to the frontline and focus on your teammates .

Earning Ribbons in BF2042 is also a great way to get big chunks of XP. You can get them by doing the following:

  • Objective: Follow orders and complete round objectives.
  • Combat: Score kills and destroy vehicles.
  • Wingman: Perform assists of any type (kills, revives, smoke, etc).
  • Logistics: Heal, resupply, and repair allies.
  • Intel: Spot and disrupt enemies.

One thing all new Battlefield players should know is that Revives are worth the same amount of XP as Kills. If you revive a squadmate, you get more XP than usual.

What About Portal?

The amount of XP you gain in Portal mode differs depending on the lobby you join . If a room is marked with a Moderate XP tag, then the XP you can get from there will be limited. Meanwhile, a room with the Full XP tag will reward you with normal amounts of XP. Matches with bots usually have the Moderate XP tag, and ever since Portal XP farms were nerfed, farming them isn't recommended unless you want less stressful matches.

Best Battle Pass XP Farm in Battlefield 2042

Leveling up your battle pass isn't as simple as leveling up your account. While you gain progress for both as you gain XP normally, you can only unlock items from the pass by getting battle pass points .

Battle pass points are obtained by reaching certain XP thresholds — these get higher as you gain points via XP. The most reliable way to progress your battle pass is to complete weekly challenges. Play well while doing these objectives, and you'll burn through your battle pass before it expires.

item.title: Concord is a Lesson for the Rest of the Industry - 365 Days Later
item.description: 365 days ago Concord released onto PlayStation and PC and then 348 days ago Concord was taken offline on PlayStation and on PC. Today on Game Rant let's talk about Concord 365 days later.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Nintendo Switch 2 Port Looking More Likely
item.description:
According to Final Fantasy 14 producer Naoki Yoshida, recent discussions with Nintendo regarding a potential Switch 2 port of the MMO have been 'positive.' Rumors that Final Fantasy 14 , along with other Final Fantasy titles, would make their way to the Nintendo Switch 2 have swirled even before the console was released in June, and fans of the franchise may have plenty to look forward to in the future.

Since its major reboot was released in 2013, Final Fantasy 14 has continued to dominate much of the MMO market, winning countless awards for its many expansions and becoming a major moneymaker for Square Enix in the years following. Earlier this month, Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.3 brought Dawntrail 's main story to a close, prompting the community to begin speculating what the developer is preparing for the next major update in the years to come. While the title is available for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X/S, those enjoying Nintendo's newest hardware may have a chance to visit Eorzea in the near future, according to new reports.

Final Fantasy 14 Producer Says Square Enix Has Had ‘Positive Discussions’ With Nintendo Over Future Switch 2 Port

In a new chat with VGC at Gamescom, Final Fantasy 14 producer Naoki Yoshida stated that Nintendo Switch 2 players may be getting some "good news" in the future. "We are putting in our best efforts to ensure that this happens," Yoshida said, while also mentioning the possibility of Final Fantasy 16 coming to the Switch 2 as well. “For me, it’s just my aim to provide Final Fantasy 14 and 16 to as many players as possible, so I hope players will look forward to possibilities in the future. But I just ask for a little bit more time." When discussing the benefits of launching Final Fantasy 14 on the Switch 2, Yoshida noted that players could be able to do more complex and demanding content on their PC, but they could also "relax on the sofa with the Switch 2 in hand, and they could do their gatherer and crafter content." The beloved game dev noted that players picking up FF14 on the Switch may have never played an MMO before, and he's excited for more users to become interested in the genre.

Unfortunately, Final Fantasy 14 has seen a downturn in both players and profits, with the Dawntrail expansion continuing to be divisive among the playerbase. However, many in the community aren't worried about the current trend, as it's common for an MMO to see a drop in players between major patches. Additionally, Dawntrail marked the beginning of an entirely new arc in the game's story, meaning that the title needs time to craft its new narrative to meet player standards after the wildly popular Endwalker expansion launched in late 2021.

During Gamescom Opening Night Live on August 19, an upcoming Final Fantasy 14 and Monster Hunter Wilds crossover was announced. Set to kick off in early October, Monster Hunter Wilds players will face off against a new beast and find iconic creatures from the Final Fantasy franchise, including Chocobo and Cactuar. In the meantime, Final Fantasy 14 players who have reached level 100 and completed the "Dawntrail" main scenario quest will face off against Guardian Arkveld.

item.title: TikTok Star KingBeardX Has Died at Age 47
item.description:
TikTok content creator John E. Crawley, aka KingBeardX, passed away on August 18 at the age of 47. Social media is a place where anybody can make content about anything and potentially grow a large following. This has allowed users to become familiar with a range of unique personalities who might otherwise have not gotten the attention they deserved. TikTok and Instagram, with their bite-sized content that can suck viewers in for hours, were two such avenues for KingBeardX.

A Mississippi-based creator, John E. Crawley’s social media popularity began growing around 2020, thanks to his funny and over-the-top reactions to things as mundane as somebody eating cinnamon rolls. His relatable observations and playful humor, combined with his trademark fluffy beard, earned KingBeardX a following of over 3.5 million across TikTok and Instagram. Crawley also went by the moniker Pimpmunkx on Twitter and formerly co-hosted a podcast with Anthony Caruso, aka Shabisky.

John E. Crawley, Known as KingBeardX, Passes Away

Caruso launched a GoFundMe campaign to raise money for Crawley’s hospital stay, which his friend revealed had begun in early August. The content creator had first presented with breathing difficulties, was put on a ventilator for low oxygen levels, and ultimately wound up in the ICU. On August 18, KingBeardX passed away at age 47, reportedly due to cardiac arrest, according to TMZ.

Understandably, fan reactions to Crawley’s passing have begun to appear on his more recent videos on TikTok and Instagram, as well as his memorial page on the Glenfield Funeral Home website. Comments such as “fly high unc” and “Tell me it’s just a rumour man” sum up the way KingBeardX’s followers are feeling in response to the news. “His videos made a lot of my bad days so much brighter,” wrote one fan under his obituary. As for the GoFundMe, it has been converted from a goal of $31,574 for Crawley’s hospital bills to $9,000 to cover his funeral costs. It has raised close to $3,000 so far.

Unfortunately, KingBeardX is not the first popular content creator to pass unexpectedly or prematurely, and he will undoubtedly not be the last. Sometimes fans have a bit of warning to prepare mentally, such as when Minecraft YouTuber Technoblade passed in 2022. But often, physical or mental health issues strike suddenly, leaving family members and followers stunned. But these content creators, even if never or only superficially met in real life, can have a lasting impact on those who remember them. Even now, annual memorial posts commemorate the passing of people like Etika and Reckful, five and six years after their deaths, respectively, and John E. Crawley's passing might inspire his fans to do the same.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Trailer Backlash Could Push Fans to Battlefield 6
item.description:
Activision finally pulled back the curtain on Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 during Gamescom Opening Night Live, but the game's latest trailer appears to be doing nothing more than pushing fans into pre-ordering Battlefield 6 . As 2025 will be the first time in four years that the two series are going head-to-head, many are eager to see if Call of Duty will continue to dominate with the launch of Black Ops 7 , or if EA's new Battlefield game truly is the return to form that it's aiming for.

The true test will come later this year, when both Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 are officially released. However, the former appears to be off to a flying start, as the Battlefield 6 open beta has already been smashing records. According to EA, the beta was the biggest playtest in Battlefield history, which isn't much of a surprise considering the shooter peaked at over 521,000 concurrent players on Steam during its opening weekend, surpassing Call of Duty 's all-time peak on the platform, which occurred nearly three years ago.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's New Trailer Is Great News for Battlefield 6

After a mind-bending reveal trailer back in June, Activision finally showed off Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 to the world during Gamescom Opening Night Live on August 19. Unfortunately, the trailer seems to be receiving tons of backlash and hate, with one comment in particular (which has amassed nearly 40,000 likes) stating, "This actually made me pre-order Battlefield 6 ." This wasn't the only comment of a similar nature either, as others said the trailer is the "best advertisement for Battlefield 6, " and another user said, "From a [ Call of Duty ] player, thank you for making it easy to choose [ Battlefield 6 ]."

While YouTube automatically hides the dislikes on videos, users have been using extensions to view the statistic, and it's not good. The numbers won't be 100% accurate, but the trailer appears to have racked up nearly 100,000 dislikes at the time of writing. Given that many of the comments seem to be discussing their desire to pre-order Battlefield 6 , it's no surprise that the trailer has so many dislikes. Exactly what it is about the trailer that has fans so unhappy will likely vary, but its futuristic gameplay in a time where fans are calling for the series to take a more grounded approach is likely a core reason.

Unrealistic cosmetic items in Call of Duty have long been a significant topic of discussion, but the community finally appears to be giving up on the franchise as their complaints and requests continue to go unheard. While this issue can be traced back all the way to the days of Advanced Warfare , Black Ops 6 took the series in a completely new direction with a constant feed of unrealistic weapon blueprints, operator skins, and more. And with Activision now confirming that all of these items will carry forward to Black Ops 7 with Season 1, fans appear to be eager to switch over to Battlefield 6 , which is taking a much more grounded and realistic approach to both its gameplay and cosmetics.
